trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> elements.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> collection type allows access to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> elements of the configuration configuration section.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlersSection.Handlers%2A> property.
Adds an <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object to the collection.
Before using this method you must create an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object and initialize it with the proper name and type.
After that, you can add the object just created to the collection.
ASP.NET searches for the handler assembly DLL in the application's private Bin directory first, and then it searches in the system assembly cache.

The collection must not already contain an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object with the same <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Verb%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Path%2A> properties.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object to add to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object to add already exists in the collection or the collection is read-only.
Removes all <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> objects from the collection.
This method inserts a `clear` directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file.
All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.
Gets the type of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType"></xref> of this collection.
Gets the collection index of the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object.
Before using this method, you must identify an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object with the proper name and type.
You can then use this object to get its collection index.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object for which to get the collection index.
The collection index value.
Gets or sets an item in this collection.
Internal use only.
The item index.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object selected.
Removes an <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object from the collection.
This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file.
If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file.
The object to remove must exist in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object to remove.
The passed <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object does not exist in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

Removes an <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object with the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Verb"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Path"></xref> properties from the collection.
This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file.
If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file.
The object to remove must exist in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Verb"></xref> property value that belongs to the handler to remove.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Path"></xref> property value that belongs to the handler to remove.
There is no <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object with the specified key in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.
Removes an <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object at the specified index location from the collection.
This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file.
If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file.
The object to remove must exist in the collection.
The collection index of the object to remove.
There is no <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.
